message.content:
cs.IT, cs.CC, cs.DS, cs.SI, cs.LG.

This paper is likely to belong to the Information Theory (cs.IT) sub-category as it deals with decision criteria for decoding in communication channels. It could also belong to the Computational Complexity (cs.CC) sub-category as decoding is a computational problem. Additionally, it could be classified under Data Structures and Algorithms (cs.DS) as decoding algorithms are studied. The paper also discusses metrics, which could place it under the Social and Information Networks (cs.SI) sub-category. Finally, the paper could be classified under Machine Learning (cs.LG) as decoding can be seen as a classification problem.
